attributes.action: make a declaration that he absolutely believes in the freedom of the press, in all of its forms, and condemns any attempts by any members of any government to suppress this freedom.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The content of the Prime Minister's latest speech has caused many people to seriously question Mr Blair's commitment to a free press.

In order to clear the air, regarding this matter, it would be in order for the PM to clarify his remarks regarding this.

The petition motion is very clear and is in accordance with the principles of our representative democracy.

Speaking about the freedom of the press to comment, the PM recently said:

"The damage saps the country's confidence and self-belief; it undermines its assessment of itself, its institutions; and above all, it reduces our capacity to take the right decisions, in the right spirit for our future.'' 

Does our current Prime Minister endorse these comments?  Or does he wish to state that he believes in the freedom of press comment?  If he does then he will, himself, support this petition and would wish to "clarify" his most recent remarks.

We await the Prime Minister's response.
